sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均有"庆祝，祝贺"之意。
means: celebrate ： 通常指举行盛大隆重的仪式庆祝或纪念有意义的日子或某件事情，多暗示节日般的欢乐场面。
congratulate ： 指对他人祝贺为目的，希望他人幸福或走运。

sentence.Network_en: The banks have had precious little to celebrate recently.
sentence.Network_cn: 银行最近没几件值得庆贺的事。

sentence.Network_en: She arrived in St Ives to celebrate the Queen's Silver Jubilee.
sentence.Network_cn: 她抵达了圣艾夫斯以庆祝女王登基25周年。

sentence.Network_en: The Vietnamese government has fixed on May 19th to celebrate his anniversary.
sentence.Network_cn: 越南政府已经决定于5月19日庆祝他的诞辰。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Latin celebrat- 'celebrated', from the verb celebrare, from celeber, celebr- 'frequented or honoured'

encyclopedia.content: 释义vt.（及物动词） 1. 庆祝 eg.We held a party to celebrate our success. 我们举行宴会庆祝我们的成功。 2. 举行锛埢槔竦纫鞘健⑶斓滹級主持 eg.They celebrated their marriage 8 years ago. 他们在八年前举行的婚庆。 3. 颂扬，赞美 eg.The event was celebrated by poets and historians. 这一事件为诗人和历史学家所赞颂。vi.（不及物动词） 1. 庆祝，过节 Today is his birthday, so we're going to celebrate. 今天是他

entry.def: If you celebrate, you do something enjoyable because of a special occasion or to mark someone's success.

example.ex: I was in a mood to celebrate...
Tom celebrated his 24th birthday two days ago.
example.tran: 汤姆两天前庆祝了他的24岁生日。

entry.def: If an organization or country is celebrating an anniversary, it has existed for that length of time and is doing something special because of it.

example.ex: The Society is celebrating its tenth anniversary this year.
example.tran: 这个协会今年将举办成立10周年庆典。

entry.def: When priests celebrate Holy Communion or Mass, they officially perform the actions and ceremonies that are involved.

example.ex: Pope John Paul celebrated mass today in a city in central Poland.
example.tran: 教皇保罗二世今天在波兰中部的一个城市主持了弥撒。

means.word_mean: 1. celebrate, as of holidays or rites;

sentences.sentence: "They were feting the patriarch of the family"
"After the exam, the students were celebrating"
"The film director was celebrated all over Hollywood"

auth_sentence.content: There was a dinner held to celebrate the win.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was a dinner held to celebrate the win.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was a dinner held to celebrate the win.

auth_sentence.content: Christians in the city are about to celebrate Christmas.
auth_sentence.res_content: Christians in the city are about to celebrate Christmas.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Christians in the city are about to celebrate Christmas.

auth_sentence.content: To celebrate Samhain the Druids built huge sacred bonfires.
auth_sentence.res_content: To celebrate Samhain the Druids built huge sacred bonfires.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To celebrate Samhain the Druids built huge sacred bonfires.

Sentence.sentence: Just over a decade into the 21st century, women's progress can be celebrated across a range of fields.

jushi.english: It's your birthday tomorrow, so we must celebrate.
jushi.chinese: 明天是你的生日,所以我们必须庆祝。

jushi.english: When the children saw the snow they celebrated.
jushi.chinese: 当孩子们看见了雪,一个个兴高采烈。

jushi.english: When the war ended, everyone celebrated.
